channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023081722
item.description:
Report X-2023081722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY A SORTER ON THE SLIDE OF THE HUB SECONDARY THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMIDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES, DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND TRANSPORDED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FUTHER ISNPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP 3/4 TURN, AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 95 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023080738
item.description:
Report X-2023080738

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Final walk for Sunrise shift and the was located at the end of a load area. It had plastic under it preventing transfer to other pkg's and surfaces. It was brought to Q/A for processing. DescribePack: Only one can totally failed leaking at the bottom of can at a corner at a seam it is a inward hole. Note: The cans are not a tight fit, they have some movement abilities. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was already on plastic and the box was transferred to a hazardous bag and tote w/ lid, while awaiting processing.

item.title: Report E-2023080824
item.description:
Report E-2023080824

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 9 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink (UN1210) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to containerize all UN1210-impacted material in one (1) 85-gallon drum for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080709
item.description:
Report X-2023080709

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OUR UNLOADING DOCK. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINS FOUR BOTTLES OF SWAN 70% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL TWO OF THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS WHICH CAUSED THEM TO SPILL OUT ALMOST COMPLETELY INTO THE PACKAGE SOAKING THROUGH IT. THE OTHER TWO BOTTLES WERE UNDAMAGED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEMS WERE PLACED INTO A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE UNDAMAGED ITEMS HAVE BEEN REPACKED TO BE RTS.

  • Description: While in transit through Charleston, MO the driver became aware of a load shift during transit and realized that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of methyl ethyl ketone (un1193) had been damaged and was releasing product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the 3 gallons of product that were released.

item.title: Report E-2023080560
item.description:
Report E-2023080560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: Concordia
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BASIC CHEMICAL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 07:30 on Monday, July 31, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering 31.25 Sodium Chlorite to a customer site (City of Concordia Water Treatment Plant) located in Concordia, MO. The driver positioned the tanker in the offload area, connected to the customer's piping system, and started the flow of product. The driver quickly walked inside the building where the customer tank is located to check the status of the tank and then walked back out of the building to monitor the offload process. Upon exiting the building the driver noticed that the customer's connection point had failed (PVC cam-lock fitting broke free from tank piping) and approximately 5-gallons of product had been spilled to the ground. The driver quickly shut down the offloading operation and notified customer site personnel who immediately contained and cleaned up the spill. No injuries or property damage occurred as a result of this spill.
